title: The Beats Behind â€˜Bel-Airâ€™: The Cast Talks Music as the Showâ€™s Emotional Core & Shares Playlists for Their OwnÂ Characters
summary: Stars Jabari Banks, Coco Jones and more of the Peacock hit's cast share the songs that define their characters' recent story arcs.
body: Peacockâ€™s  Bel-Air  has taken the beloved â€™90s sitcom starring Will Smith and reimagined it as something entirely new: a gritty, hour-long drama that dives deep into class disparity, institutionalized racism, the pressures of growing up and so much more. This version has just as much humor and heart as the original, but also dives deep into family, identity and mental health with a depth that the original half-hour format couldnâ€™t allow. Now entering its fourth and final season,  Bel-Air  follows Will as he navigates his senior year and his looming future, while Carlton faces decisions that could shape his entire life. Behind the drama, thereâ€™s another character that drives the story: music.  On  Bel-Air , music isnâ€™t just a backdrop, itâ€™s a heartbeat. A mood. A mirror held up to every character trying to find their place in a world that demands reinvention. Across the castâ€™s conversations, one theme came up again and again: the soundtrack isnâ€™t simply something you hear in  Bel-Air , itâ€™s something the characters feel, something the actors use, and something the audience remembers long after the screen fades to black. Grammy-winner Coco Jones, wâ€¦

title: Karol G & Feid Earn Their First Collaborative No. 1 With â€˜VeranoÂ Rosaâ€™
summary: Plus, Grupo CaÃ±averal & Marisela celebrate big with their first No. 1 on the Regional Mexican Airplay chart.
body: Karol G and Feid ‘s “Verano Rosa” marks the pairâ€™s first collaborative No. 1 as the song soars to the top of Billboard â€™s Latin Airplay chart (dated Nov. 29). It becomes the third track from Karol’s album Tropicoqueta to claim the top spot. This achievement also earns Karol G her 20th chart-topper and Feid his 11th. “Verano Rosa” flies 9-1 on the overall Latin radio ranking with a 55% boost in audience impressions, to 8.9 million, earned in the United States during the tracking week ending Nov. 20th, as reported by Luminate. The track also takes the Greatest Gainer honor, awarded to the song with the largest audience growth of the week. While multiple two-way collaborations have topped the Latin Airplay chart in 2025, â€œVerano Rosaâ€ stands out as only the second female-male pairing to achieve the feat. Earlier in the year, Silvestre Dangond and Emilia claimed the No. 1 spot with their hit â€œVestido Rojo” (which coincidentally shares the same initials as Karol and Feid’s track, VR) leading the chart for one week in June. Karol and Feidâ€™s previous collab, â€œFrikiâ€ took them to a No. 36 high on Latin Airplay in 2022. Meanwhile, â€œ+57,â€ wherâ€¦

body: It took four years following 2021 predecessor Sitll Over It , but R&B star Summer Walker ‘s Finally Over It finally arrived two Fridays ago (Nov. 14). The third and presumed installment in Walker’s highly acclaimed Over It album series debuts at No. 2 on the Billboard 200 albums chart this week, with 77,000 first-week units. The numbers mark the best debut for an album by a woman R&B artist in 2025 â€” defining such albums as those that are eligible for, or have charted on, Billboard â€™s Top R&B Albums chart â€” but are down from Still , which entered at No. 1 with 166,000 units in 2021. How do those numbers compare to our expectations? And does the album itself live up to the first two parts of the trilogy? Billboard staffers answer these questions and more below. 1. Summer Walkerâ€™s Finally Over It debuts at No. 2 this week with 77,000 equivalent album units. Are those numbers higher, lower, or about what you expected for it? Mackenzie Cummings-Grady : This is personally right in line with what I expected, and if No. 1 wasnâ€™t T-Swift and it wasnâ€™t the week before Thanksgiving, this number easily could have been higher. title: Red Spider Nebula
summary: Using its Near-InfraRed Camera (NIRCam), NASAâ€™s James Webb Space Telescope captured never-before-seen details of the Red Spider Nebula, a planetary nebula, in this image released on Oct. 26, 2025. NIRCam is Webbâ€™s primary near-infrared imager, providing high-resolution imaging and spectroscopy for â€¦
body: ESA/Webb, NASA & CSA, J. H. Kastner (Rochester Institute of Technology) Using its Near-InfraRed Camera (NIRCam), NASAâ€™s James Webb Space Telescope captured never-before-seen details of the Red Spider Nebula, a planetary nebula, in this image released on Oct. 26, 2025 . NIRCam is Webb’s primary near-infrared imager, providing high-resolution imaging and spectroscopy for a wide variety of investigations. Webbâ€™s new view of the Red Spider Nebula reveals for the first time the full extent of the nebulaâ€™s outstretched lobes, which form the â€˜legsâ€™ of the spider. These lobes, shown in blue, are traced by light emitted from H2 molecules, which contain two hydrogen atoms bonded together. Stretching over the entirety of NIRCamâ€™s field of view, these lobes are shown to be closed, bubble-like structures that each extend about 3 light-years. Outflowing gas from the center of the nebula has inflated these massive bubbles over thousands of years. Image credit: ESA/Webb, NASA & CSA, J. H. Kastner (Rochester Institute of Technology)

title: NASA Crater Detection Challenge
summary: Crater rims are vital landmarks for planetary science and navigation. Yet detecting them in real imagery is tough, with shadows, lighting shifts, and broken edges obscuring their shape. This project invites you to develop methods that can reliably fit ellipses to crater rims, helping advance futureâ€¦
body: NASAâ€™s Lucy spacecraft captured images of the Moonâ€™s surface on Oct 16, 2022, after flying by the Earth for its first of three gravity assists. Crater rims are vital landmarks for planetary science and navigation. Yet detecting them in real imagery is tough, with shadows, lighting shifts, and broken edges obscuring their shape. This project invites you to develop methods that can reliably fit ellipses to crater rims, helping advance future space exploration. In the pursuit of next generation, terrain-based optical navigation, NASA is developing a system that will use a visible-light camera on a spacecraft to capture orbital images of lunar terrain and process the imagery to: detect the crater rims in the images, identify the craters from a catalog, and estimate the camera/vehicle position based on the identified craters. The focus of this project is the crater detection process. Natural imagery varies significantly in lighting and will impact the completeness of crater rims in the images. Award: $55,000 in total prizes Open Date: November 25, 2025 Close Date: January 19, 2026 For more information, visit: https://www.topcoder.com/nasa-crater-detection

title: NASA Orbiter Shines New Light on Long-Running Martian Mystery
summary: Results from an enhanced radar technique have demonstrated improvement to sub-surface observations of Mars. NASAâ€™s Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter (MRO) has revisited and raised new questions about a mysterious feature buried beneath thousands of feet of ice at the Red Planetâ€™s south pole. In a recent â€¦
body: 5 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) The European Space Agencyâ€™s Mars Express orbiter captured this view of Marsâ€™ south polar ice cap Feb. 25, 2015. Three years later, the spacecraft detected a signal from the area to the right of the ice cap that scientists interpreted as an underground lake. ESA/DLR/FU Berlin, CC BY-SA 3.0 IGO Results from an enhanced radar technique have demonstrated improvement to sub-surface observations of Mars.   NASAâ€™s Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter (MRO) has revisited and raised new questions about a mysterious feature buried beneath thousands of feet of ice at the Red Planetâ€™s south pole. In a recent study, researchers conclude from data obtained using an innovative radar technique that an area on Mars suspected of being an underground lake is more likely to be a layer of rock and dust.   The 2018 discovery of the suspected lake set off a flurry of scientific activity, as water is closely linked with life in the solar system. While the latest findings indicate this feature is not a lake below the Martian surface, it does suggest that the same radar technique could be used to check for subsurface resoâ€¦

title: Circle to Search now lets you have deeper conversations about whatâ€™s on your screen
summary: Replacing standard image search with Google's AI Mode.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Circle to Searchâ€™s text search feature now defaults to Googleâ€™s AI Mode. Previously, any additional text queries in Circle to Search would default to the standard image search. The feature was teased in July and is now starting to roll out. Googleâ€™s AI Mode originated as a smarter and resourceful alternative to Search, but has since proliferated to other spots on your phone. A few months ago, Google added a direct AI Mode shortcut under the search bar in the Google app on Android, soon followed by AI Mode being added to Circle to Search for Samsungâ€™s recently launched foldables â€” which was rolled out to other Android devices shortly after. Despite this addition, Circle to Search defaulted to regular image search when asked any add-on questions. But this appears to be changing now, with additional queries along with images going to AI Mode, starting the Google appâ€™s version 16.47.49.

From Android phones and tablets to headphones and smart home hardware, your options are wide-ranging and numerous. Weâ€™ve pulled together our curated pick of the best Black Friday deals of 2025. The offers will change, and new ones will be launched as the week progresses, so weâ€™ll keep updating this page regularly. Feel free to bookmark it if you want to periodically check out what deals are available.

title: Your Chrome address bar on Android could soon become an image generator
summary: Google is testing a new home for Nano Banana, its viral AI image generator, in Chrome for Android.
body: Credit: Google TL;DR Google has brought the Nano Banana image generator from desktop over to Chrome Canary on Android. The feature allows users to generate images by tapping a new plus icon in the address bar and selecting â€œCreate image.â€ Images appear directly in the browser, offering quick download and sharing options. In recent weeks, Google has been teasing the future of its web browser and stuffing new AI capabilities into the Canary build of Chrome. However, those experiments have been mostly tethered to the browserâ€™s desktop version. Thatâ€™s changing, as Google is now testing its experimental Nano Banana image generator in Chrome Canary on Android.

title: This ultrawide Samsung gaming monitor just got a huge price drop!
summary: This is the $520 Black Friday discount ultrawide monitor fans were waiting for.
body: Credit: Samsung via Amazon Black Friday always brings a few eyebrow-raising discounts, and this Samsung gem is definitely one of them. The 49-inch Odyssey G9 G95C is one of the brandâ€™s most over-the-top gaming monitors, and it has fallen to $777.99 on Samsungâ€™s site, down from $1,299.99. If youâ€™ve been circling the idea of going super-ultrawide, this is the kind of price that makes the jump a lot easier to justify. The Samsung G95C monitor isnâ€™t subtle. Itâ€™s a massive 32:9 curved DQHD panel that essentially gives you the screen real estate of two 27-inch QHD monitors stitched together without bezels getting in the way. The steep 1000R curve wraps around your peripheral vision, and paired with its 240Hz refresh rate, 1ms response time, and FreeSync Premium Pro, itâ€™s built for fast, fluid gameplay rather than just looking dramatic on a desk.

title: YouTube is testing a custom feed that lets you finally fix your messy home page
summary: Tired of your YouTube feed? Just tell the new AI chatbot what you want to see.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR A new â€œYour Custom Feedâ€ chip in YouTube lets select users switch to a more personalized feed powered by an AI chatbot. The experimental feature will appear next to the standard â€œHomeâ€ button. For years, YouTube has felt like a benevolent dictator telling you what you should be watching. Now, things might be changing as YouTube is poking at one of the most sensitive parts of its platform: the home feed.â€‹

title: Looks like OnePlus phones and smartwatches are experiencing some bad weather (Updated: Fixed)
summary: A core Oxygen OS failure is reportedly causing weather data to be lost across the OnePlus ecosystem.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR OnePlus phones and smartwatches are showing stale or missing weather data, and users across multiple models are all seeing the same outage. Devices running various Oxygen OS versions (14, 15, and 16) are all affected, pointing to a central OnePlus service failure. OnePlus has not yet acknowledged the issue, but a fix is necessary and expected soon. Update: The issue has been resolved. Update, November 25, 2025 (03:40 AM ET): The issue with OnePlus phones and watches showing stale or no weather data has been resolved. The OnePlus Weather app is also working again. Original article, November 24, 2025 (05:40 AM ET): If your OnePlus smartphone or smartwatch suddenly shows stale weather data (or none at all), youâ€™re not alone. A bunch of OnePlus users are reporting that the native weather app simply refuses to update.

title: Chrome for Android could soon get a new layer of location privacy
summary: Chrome for Android is testing a new setting that lets you give websites only the location details you want.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google is testing a new approximate location option for Chromeâ€™s Android app. Unlike Androidâ€™s system-level location controls for apps, the new option should give users more granular control over the level of location permissions different websites can access. The option allows Chrome to retain precise location permission at the app level while still enabling you to grant only approximate location to individual sites. Chrome for Android is quietly testing a smarter, more privacy-friendly location-sharing option that lets users share only their approximate location with websites. The new option is not to be confused with Androidâ€™s system-level location controls for apps. Instead, it appears to be designed to give Chrome users on Android more granular control over the level of location permissions different websites can access.

title: NASA, NOAA Rank 2025 Ozone Hole as 5th Smallest Since 1992
summary: The ozone hole over the Antarctic was small in 2025 compared to previous years and remains on track to recover later this century. The hole this year was the fifth smallest since 1992, the year a landmark international agreement to phase out ozone-depleting chemicals began to take effect.
body: 5 min read NASA, NOAA Rank 2025 Ozone Hole as 5th Smallest Since 1992 Earth (ESD) Earth Explore Explore Earth Home Agriculture Air Quality Climate Change Freshwater Life on Earth Severe Storms Snow and Ice The Global Ocean Science at Work Earth Science at Work Technology and Innovation Powering Business Multimedia Image Collections Videos Data For Researchers About Us While continental in scale, the ozone hole over the Antarctic was small in 2025 compared to previous years and remains on track to recover later this century, NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) reported. The hole this year was the fifth smallest since 1992, the year a landmark international agreement to phase out ozone-depleting chemicals began to take effect. At the height of this yearâ€™s depletion season from Sept. 7 through Oct. 13, the average extent of the ozone hole was about 7.23 million square miles (18.71 million square kilometers) â€” thatâ€™s twice the area of the contiguous United States. The 2025 ozone hole is already breaking up, nearly three weeks earlier than usual during the past decade. This map shows the size and shape of the ozone hole over the South Pole on the day of â€¦

title: The future is now: TCL CSOT sets the benchmark for display technologies at DTC 2025
summary: We take a closer look at the innovative display technology breakthroughs TCL CSOT showcased at their annual DTC 2025 event.
body: Between our phones, tablets, laptops, PC monitors, TVs, smartwatches, AR/XR devices, car infotainment systems, and other smart home tech, weâ€™re basically looking at displays everywhere, all the time. Like any tech, displays have steadily evolved â€“ resolutions get bigger, refresh rates get faster, screens get brighter, and PPI get denser. And no companyâ€™s doing more right now to push the boundaries of display technology than TCL China Star Optoelectronics Technology (TCL CSOT). TCL CSOT, a global leader in advanced display technologies and a subsidiary of TCL Technology (000100.SZ), showcases its latest innovations at the Global Display Tech-Ecosystem Conference (DTC). This yearly event brings together display industry experts, media, and ecosystem partners to discuss cutting-edge display technologies and future development trends.

title: I asked Gemini to help me get a six-pack, and itâ€™s kinda working
summary: I have experienced issues during the process, though.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority Iâ€™ve always been an active, sporty type of person. I regularly cycle, run, lift weights, hike, and swim. Iâ€™m beyond terrible at the last one, but I try. However, I have a specific fitness goal in mind, which is to get a six-pack, and that requires a bit of planning instead of doing random sports activities based on my mood, like Iâ€™m used to.

And if youâ€™re looking for some of the best in the business, look no further than Narwal .

title: Jealous of Pixelâ€™s new AirDrop trick? Qualcomm hints itâ€™s coming to many more Android phones
summary: The chipmaker aims to enable Pixel-style AirDrop transfers on Snapdragon-powered phones in "the near future."
body: TL;DR Qualcomm has said that itâ€™s bringing Pixel 10-style AirDrop support to Snapdragon-powered phones. This means many more Android phones could soon support Quick Share-AirDrop file transfers. The chipmaker says itâ€™ll enable support on Snapdragon devices in â€œthe near future.â€ Google shocked everyone last week by quietly flipping the switch on true AirDrop support for the Pixel 10 series . But if youâ€™re feeling left out because your Android phone canâ€™t do the same just yet, you might be happy to hear what Qualcomm has to say. The chipmaker has now confirmed that itâ€™s working to bring this cross-platform file sharing feature to Snapdragon-powered phones, massively widening the pool of Android devices that may soon join the Quick Share-AirDrop party. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: I tried using Gemini to track my expenses â€” it didnâ€™t even come close
summary: It has all my data but none of the smarts.
body: Ever since AI made a hard landing in our lives, I wake up every day to a new way it could automate some random chore and make my life just a little less miserable and a lot easier. AI can do what it does best â€” analyze data and find patterns â€” and that basic system could help with a lot of everyday stuff in my life. One thing that matters a lot to me and where I really wish AI would help is expense tracking and budgeting. There was a version of me a few years ago who did not care how often I swiped my cards or how much those random, expensive sprees were costing me. They were not all wasteful expenses, but I did not really know where exactly my money was going. After my bank balance started taking a hit, I could no longer ignore and did something I had never done before: I started tracking my expenses.

title: Iâ€™m amazed by Googleâ€™s bold Pixel AirDrop move, but I have 3 big concerns
summary: Google has pushed the first rock, but we could be standing before an avalanche.
body: Google surprised everyone this week by doing the unthinkable and rolling out AirDrop support for the Pixel 10 without any hacks, directly through Quick Share . If you have a Pixel 10 like me, now you can Quick Share with any iPhone , iPad, and Mac, or even AirDrop back from Apple devices to your Pixel. And even though it requires enabling sharing for â€œEveryone for 10 minutesâ€ on both devices, itâ€™s seamless and brilliant, and makes me wonder why we couldnâ€™t have had this years ago. However, the unexpected news has certainly left many of us scratching our heads. We first suspected the European Unionâ€™s Digital Markets Act (DMA) had something to do with it, but since Google essentially went rogue and implemented it without Appleâ€™s help , it seems thatâ€™s not the case. The timing is certainly â€œinteresting,â€ though. Still, I have some questions and concerns about this bold Google move.

title: Google finally did it: AirDrop now works on Android!
summary: Quick Share is finally compatible with AirDrop, plus an early look at the Galaxy Buds 4 Pro and Samsungâ€™s take on Magic Cue.
body: This week, Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown discuss the bombshell news that Google has updated Quick Share to be compatible with Appleâ€™s AirDrop â€” without Appleâ€™s help. They also break down the leaked design and new â€œhead gestureâ€ features of the Samsung Galaxy Buds 4 Pro and analyze the new â€œNow Nudgesâ€ coming to One UI 8.5. The Authority Insights Podcast is a new weekly show from the Android Authority team hosted by Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown. In each episode, weâ€™ll break down the latest exclusive reports, app teardowns, and leaks from the Android Authority team.

title: 5 AI tools that can help you start and run an online business
summary: Get things done faster and cheaper.
body: Credit: Mitja Rutnik / Android Authority Thanks to AI, starting an online business has never been easier. Technology can dramatically speed things up in more areas than you can imagine, and it also lowers the cost of both starting and running a business. However, you need the right tools for the job. There are a lot of AI tools out there, but I want to highlight just five to give you an idea of whatâ€™s possible. These will help you in all phases of your business journey, from planning to launching a business and then managing certain aspects of it.

title: This is how Google convinced me to pay for a more expensive Google One plan
summary: I would've never shelled out for Google AI Pro without this new perk.
body: As a longtime Gmail and Google Photos user, Iâ€™ve always had my eye on Google One subscription plans. For the better part of a decade, I tried just about anything to avoid paying up for Google One storage , pushing the free 15GB of cloud storage to its limit. Eventually, mass-deleting emails and photos to free up cloud storage space took its toll, and soon I found myself paying $2 a month for Google One Basic. That only solved my data cap problems for one Google account; not long after, I shelled out for Google One Premium to share 2TB of cloud storage across all my accounts. Subscriptions can get out of hand quickly, so Google One Premium at $10 per month was all I could muster. Despite owning multiple Nest displays and a Nest Video Doorbell, I stuck with only three hours of event recording to avoid paying another $10 for Nest Aware each month. Plus, my smart home is split between the Apple and Google ecosystems. Paying for Apple One gave me an unlimited number of HomeKit Secure Video (HSV) cameras with a 10-day recording history, making Nest Aware hard to justify.
